project_abstract.cdata: Since inadequacies in electric generating capacity are likely to be a constraint on China's medium term growth objectives and potential, the Government has given high priority to electric power.  In line with this, the proposed project seeks to (i) address the acute power shortage at a major load center in the East China power grid; (ii) support development of a modern distribution network master plan for the city of Shanghai; (iii) promote efficiency in the Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Bureau through a staff training program; and (iv) encourage financial reform.  Accordingly, the project entails an extension of the existing coal-fired Wujing thermal power station by adding two generating units of 300 MW each; construction of associated 220 kV transmission lines and substations; provision of on-line computer control and automotic load dispatching system for the Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Bureau's (SMEPB) load dispatching center; a master plan study of the distribution network in Shanghai; and a training program.

P003497.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ZH</LangCode><ProjectName>吴泾电厂项目</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>由于发电能力不足有可能制约中国中期增长目标的实现和增长潜力，因此中国政府高度重视电力行业发展。按照这一重点安排，本项目力求：（1）解决华东电网主要负载中心上海市的电力紧缺问题；（2）支持上海市制定现代化配电网总体规划；（3）通过人员培训提升上海市电力局工作效率；（4）鼓励实行财政改革。为此，项目安排了以下内容：（1）新增两台300兆瓦发电机组，增加现有燃煤热电厂吴泾电厂的装机容量；（2）架设配套220千伏输电线路；（3）为上海市电力局负荷调度中心建立在线计算机控制和负荷自动调度系统；（4）就上海市配电网总体规划开展研究；（5）开展培训。</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
